About Me

Nuts & Bolts

Professionally I am Rails fan who dabbles in Python. My current interests are in more functional programming such as Elixir and Haskell. Lately I've been abandoning Rails Active Record queries in favor of creating PostgreSQL views. I enjoy learning about system adminstration and writting tests for my code, although I often find clients don't want to pay for it. Outside of coding I wrench old motorcycles (pre-1982), mostly British stuff but I like old Yamaha dirtbikes as well.

My expertise

Stuff that i can help with

Ruby on Rails

Whether adding new functionality, debugging, testing, or making updates, if it's anything to do with RoR I can help.

JavaScript

JavaScript is fun and I enjoy slinging data around. Well versed in Angular, Backbone, Knockout, D3, some Node.

SQL

PostgreSQL and MySQL, I appreciate good architecture. Lately I've been experimenting with PostgreSQL's recursive querying.

Project Management and Estimation

I like keeping things organized. Estimating is inherently challenging in software, I think I'm improving everyday.

E-Commerce

I worked on Wall Street for 5 years, now I work extensively on e-commerce sites.

Client Representation and Consultation

Getting to learn about an industry or how a business works is another great benefit to software development. Over the years I have been in constant contact with CEOs and business owners, their success is mine and I love helping to make their passions profitable.
